alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:12PM EST until January 11 at 12:09AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Philadelphia affecting Philadelphia and Montgomery Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Philadelphia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Philadelphia. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.4 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between North Ferry Road and Falls Bridge. At 11.0 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between Hunting Park Avenue and Falls Bridge. The Flat Rock area is flooded. At 11.5 feet, Route 1 off ramp to Ridge Avenue is flooded and closed. MLK Drive is flooded and closed between Greenland Drive and Montgomery Drive. At 12.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk floods in the area of Shurs Lane. At 13.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk is closed from Ridge Avenue to Leverington Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 12.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 10/09/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Philadelphia 11.0 8.2 Tue 9 pm 10.1 8.4 12.2 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
